turns.content: What is the current world record for the women's 100-meter sprint and who holds it?
The current world record for the women's 100-meter sprint is 10.49 seconds, and it is held by Florence Griffith-Joyner of the United States.
Wow, that's incredibly fast! When did Florence Griffith-Joyner set that world record?
Florence Griffith-Joyner set the current world record for the women's 100-meter sprint on July 16, 1988, at the U.S. Olympic Trials in Indianapolis, Indiana.
That's almost 33 years ago! Do you think anyone will break her record anytime soon?

As an AI language model, I do not have personal thoughts or opinions. However, breaking a record like that requires an exceptional level of natural talent, rigorous training, and access to the best possible resources. While progress and innovation in athletic training methods, equipment, and facilities continue, the margin of improvement over a record as fast as Florence Griffith-Joyner's is relatively narrow. Nonetheless, athletes are always pushing themselves to their physical limits, so it is possible that someone could one day break her record.
